intro: Evacopsis montana, commonly known as the mountain evaporation plant, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is native to high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Evacopsis montana is adapted to cold, dry environments and plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
